Watch: E doesn't equal mc2, it doesn't, it doesn't! I was lying, so there!
author: Daniel C. Dennett,

quote: You’ll only fall if you doubt your balance.
author: Willa Okati,

quote: The measure of your faith is the measure of the pain you can endure.
author: Dan Brown,

quote: All right, God, say that You are really there. You have put me in this fix. You want to test me. Suppose I test You? Suppose I say that You are not there? You've given me a supreme test with my parents and with these boils. I think that I have passed Your test. I am tougher than You. If You will come down here right now, I will spit into Your face, if You have a face. And do You shit? The priest never answered that question. He told us not to doubt. Doubt what? I think that You have been picking on me too much so I am asking You to come down here so I can put You to the test! I waited. Nothing. I waited for God. I waited and waited. I believe I slept.
author: Charles Bukowski,

quote: Their lives were violent, precarious, fragile, but they fought for them anyway, and held to the hope that their brief stay on this earth might count for something. That faith was worth preserving.
author: Leigh Bardugo,

quote: Faith means I chose not to know, which is different than ignorance which refuses to know.
author: Craig D. Lounsbrough
tags: belief, choice, choose, choosing, faith, god, ignorance, ignorant, jaded, know, knowing, refusal, refuse, stubborn, trust, trusting, unbelief

quote: Faith can move mountains. So why are you stumbling on a little rock?
author: Jonathan Nettles

quote:
Dr. Keller begins pacing. "I don't think we've been hearing Faith just right. Her guard...the words..they sound alike."

What do you mean?"

Your daughter," Dr. Keller says flatly. "I think she's seeing God.
author: Jodi Picoult,

quote: Sometimes God has to destroy in order to save. He has to wound in order to heal.
author: Francine Rivers,

quote: Put your heart and soul into whatever you do – but you won’t be able to do so until you have complete faith in whatever you are doing.
author: Dr Prem Jagyasi
tags: able, achieve, believe, complete, confident, faith, heart-and-soul, learn, succeed, task

quote: If it be well weighed, to say that a man lieth, is as much to say, as that he is brave towards God and a coward towards men.
author: Michel de Montaigne
tags: cowardice, faith, god, men, truth, veracity

quote: We can say that true gratitude does not give rise to the debtor's ethic because it gives rise to faith in future grace. With true gratitude there is such a delight in the worth of God's past grace, that we are driven on to experience more and more of it in the future...it is done by transforming gratitude into faith as it turns from contemplating the pleasures of past grace and starts contemplating the promises of the future.
author: John Piper

quote: Ivy shrugs. “Poisoning is the Marauders’ way. No offense, but feel free to take some.
author: S.G. Blaise,
tags: exploration, faith, fast-paced, guardians, hope, lies, mysterious, plots, secrets, treachery

quote: We pray for the big things and forget to give thanks for the ordinary, small (and yet really not small) gifts.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer,

quote: God has been there with us every step of the way.
author: Gregory S. Works,
tags: altering, chronic-illness, diseases, faith, heal, healing, life, mental, spiritual

quote: As the fear of God is the beginning of wisdom, so the denial of God is the height of foolishness.
author: R.C. Sproul,

quote: I believe in God the way I believe in quarks. People whose business it is to know about quantum physics or religion tell me they have good reason to believe that quarks and God exist. And they tell me that if I wanted to devote my life to learning what they've learned, I'd find quarks and God just like they did.
author: Mary Doria Russell,

quote: Indeed, a quick glance around this broken world makes it painfully obvious that we don't need more arguments on behalf of God; we need more people who live as if they are in covenant with Unconditional Love, which is our best definition of God. (p. 21)
author: Robin R. Meyers,

quote: I am more afraid that this people have so much confidence in their leaders that they will not inquire for themselves of God whether they are led by him. I am fearful they settle down in a state of blind self security. Let every man and woman know, by the whispering of the Spirit of God to themselves, whether their leaders are walking in the path the Lord dictates, or not.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Maybe, if you can't get someone out of your head they were never meant to leave. Perhaps, they were meant to help change you into the person you have been waiting to become.
author: shannon l. alder
tags: aquaintances, encounters, faith, faith-in-others, faith-in-yourself, family, friends, hanging-on, hello, hope, love, no-coincidences, relationships, strangers, trust, trusting

quote: It is better to dwell on the beautiful things in life than the negative.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita,
tags: beautiful, faith, grace, grateful, happiness, hope, influences, inspiration, joy, life, negative-influence, negative-people, negative-thoughts, negativity, opinions-of-others, positive-thinking, positivity, thankfulness, wise-words

quote: Alone: for the first time I understood the terrible significance of that word. Alone without a witness, without anyone to speak to, without refuge. The breath in my body, the blood in my veins, all this hurly-burly in my head existed for nobody.
author: Simone de Beauvoir,

quote: Hardships are the Lord's greatest blessings to the believer. Without them we would love the Lord only for what He does for us. Our troubles teach us to love Him for who He is." Sister Norton in "The Preacher's Bride
author: Jody Hedlund

quote: Faith is the cure that heals all troubles. Without faith there is no hope and no love. Faith comes before hope, and before love. (Sheikh Muhammad ibn Zaidi bani Tihama)
author: Paul Torday,

quote: For I think belief in God is not a matter of reason at all; I think it finally is a matter of love.
author: William Peter Blatty,

quote: Without being push to the wall, we will have remained in our comfortable zone. But this circumstance challenges us to find the courage to move on.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita,
tags: adversity, capable, challenges, christian-life, circumstance, comfort, courage, defeat, determined-spirit, difficulties-of-life, dont-give-up, failure, faith, fearless, fighting-spirit, hope, inner-strength, never-give-up, obstacles, overcomer, overcoming-obstacles, perseverance, quitting, self-help, self-motivation, self-worth, strength-and-courage, strong-woman, success, victory, winners-mentality, you-can

quote: The doing of something productive regardless of the outcome is an act of faith. The doing of a small something when a large something is too much for us is perhaps especially an act of faith. Faith means going forward by whatever means we can.
author: Julia Cameron,

quote: Faith is not something that goes against the evidence, it goes beyond it. The evidence is saying to us, 'There is another country. There is something beyond mere reason'.
author: Alister E. McGrath

quote: In seven days God had created the Earth. In a single day mankind had turned it upside down.
author: Kristina McMorris,
tags: faith, god, inspirational, japanese-fiction, philosophy-religion, war, world-war-ii

quote:
To be honest with you, I don't have the words to make you feel better, but I do have the arms to give you a hug, ears to listen to whatever you want to talk about, and I have a heart; a heart that's aching to see you smile again.

lines from Love Vs Destiny...
author: Atul Purohit

quote: All religions are man-made; God has not yet revealed himself beyond doubt to anybody.
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana,
tags: afterlife, agnostic, agnostic-atheism, agnostic-prayer, agnostic-quote, agnostic-quotes, agnosticism, agnostics, atheism, atheism-defined, atheism-quotes, atheist, atheist-argument, atheist-arguments, atheist-claims, atheist-club, atheist-philosophers, atheist-quotes, atheistic, atheistic-philosophy, atheistic-religion, atheists, bangambiki, belief, belief-in-god, belief-quotes, belief-system, beliefs-quotes, believer, believing, debate, doubt, doubters, doubtful, doubtful-thoughts, doubtfulness, doubting, doubting-mind, doubts, doubts-quotes, ethics, existence, existentialism, faith, faith-in-god, faith-in-yourself, faith-quotes, faith-reason, faith-vs-reason, faithful, faithfulness, false-god, false-gods, fear-of-god, god, goddess, gods, habyarimana-bangambiki, heaven, heaven-and-hell, heaven-on-earth, heaven-quotes, heavenly, heavenly-father, heavenly-rewards, heavens, life, man-made, materialism, meaning-of-life, morality, naturalism, paradise, paradise-quotes, paradises, religion, religion-and-philoshophy, religion-spirituality, religion-vs-science, religious, religious-faith, respect, revelation-quotes, revelations, secular-ethics, self-respect, spirituality, spirituality-quotes, spirituality-vs-religion, supernaturalism, the-great-pearl-of-wisdom, there-is-no-god, unbelief, unbelieve-quotes, unbeliever, unbelievers

quote: Bombs have kill-radiuses; churches should have love-radiuses--anyone within twenty miles of a church should know it.
author: Tyler Edwards,

quote:
Break my heart for what breaks yours
Everything I am for Your Kingdom's cause
As I walk from earth into eternity
author: Hillsong United

quote: Even if things aren't going the way we want right now, we will always get through it.
author: Stacey T. Hunt,
tags: always, faith, going, hope, right-now, things, things-that-matter, through, want, way, we, will, willpower

quote:
And if there is no god?
You act as if there is, and it's the same thing.
author: Janet Fitch,

quote: As long as we remain vigilant at building our internal abundance—an abundance of integrity, an abundance of forgiveness, an abundance of service, an abundance of love—then external lack is bound to be temporary.
author: Marianne Williamson,

quote: This is the story of how Dad lived with his lung cancer. But it is much more. Through his illness and the miracles we experienced, I came to see that Dad's was not just a journey. It was a journey home. Home to God.
author: Joseph M. Hanneman,

quote: If you hold a candle close to you, its flame rises. And if you hold it away from you, its flame shrinks. The same way you hold a candle close to you, keep all your plans, aspirations, projects, and dreams close to you too. Do not share your plans or goals until you complete them, because as you hold your candle away from you, your goals will shrink in the eyes of others. Envy, jealousy, and resentment will put out your flame before it grows.
author: Suzy Kassem,
tags: aspirations, dreams, faith, inspirational, life, plans, projects, quotes, suzy-kassem

quote: The problem that we are facing in the church today is that we have so many Christians who have made a decision to believe in Jesus but not a commitment to follow Him. We have people who are planning to, meaning to, trying to, wanting to, going to, we just don't have people who are doing it.
author: Tyler Edwards,

quote: Why do some persons 'find' God in a way that others do not? Why does God manifest His Presence to some and let multitudes of others struggle along in the half-light of imperfect Christian experience? Of course the will of God is the same for all. He has no favorites within His household. All He has ever done for any of His children He will do for all of His children. The difference lies not with God but with us.
author: A.W. Tozer,
tags: belief, christian, christianity, faith, god, god-s-presence

quote: God seemed to have become a brand, a packaging, and people purchase this trusted brand with such faith and devotion that they no longer care who the vendor is.
author: Justin Villanueva,
tags: atheism, atheist, blind-faith, catholic, christian, dogma, faith, freethinker, god, humor, religion

quote: He will never let her go. Never. she belongs to him..Forever.
author: Awwthentic,
tags: awwthentic, belief, bookworm, couple, diary, dreams, ebook-ereading, fairy, faith, friends, heart, love, loveletter, lovers, note, prince, romance, rose, wattpad, wattpadaddicts, wattpadlife, wattpadshouts, wattpadstories, wishes

quote: There was no way to abandon guilt, no decent way to disown it. All the tangles and knots of bitterness and desperation and fear had to be pitied. No, better, grace had to fall over them.
author: Marilynne Robinson,

quote: Love taught me to die with dignity that I might come forth anew in splendor. Born once of flesh, then again of fire, I was reborn a third time to the sound of my name humming haikus in heaven’s mouth.
author: Aberjhani,
tags: death, dignity, faith, haiku, healing, heaven, human-mortality, love, metaphysics, national-poetry-month, philosophy, rebirth, recovery, resurrection, spirituality, starting-over, wisdom

quote: Whatever your passion is, keep doing it. Don't waste time chasing after success or comparing yourself to others. Every flower blooms at a different pace. Excel at doing what your passion is and only focus on perfecting it. Eventually people will see what you are great at doing, and if you are truly great, success will come chasing after you.
author: Suzy Kassem,
tags: achievement, ambition, attitude, blooms, chase, comparing-to-others, comparison, comparison-to-others, doubt, drive, excel, excellent, faith, fear, flower, focus, great, greatness, insecurity, life, motivation, passion, passionate, skill, success, successful, time, waste-time, willpower

quote: Whatever negative things people think and say about you is enough to bring you down provided you belief that it carries a weight that can push you hard. Don't agree to accept what critics say; be prepared to silence them by doing what they think you can't do!
author: Israelmore Ayivor,
tags: agree, belief, believe, carry, critic, criticise, critics, detractors, discouragements, enemies, fail, failure, faith, fall, food-for-thought, hard, heavy, insults, israelmore-ayivor, lower, negative, negative-people, prepare, push, push-hard, silence, weight, you-can-do-it

quote: It isn't for the moment you are struck that you need courage, but for that long uphill climb back to sanity and faith and security.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh
tags: courage, faith, grieving, grieving-mother, sanity, security

quote: It is hard to see how a great man can be an atheist. Without the sustaining influence of faith in a divine power we could have little faith in ourselves. We need to feel that behind us is intelligence and love. Doubters do not achieve; skeptics do not contribute; cynics do not create. Faith is the great motive power, and no man realizes his full possibilities unless he has the deep conviction that life is eternally important, and that his work, well done, is a part of an unending plan.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: People will always notice something about you. It might be the way you walk or the way you talk, or just simply your personality. Live each day in the way you want to be remembered. Live in such a way that people will be inspired by those unique qualities that you have and strive to live better lives for themselves.
author: Amaka Imani Nkosazana
tags: compassion, faith, happiness, hope, inspiration, kindness, life, living, love, passionate, peace, peace-of-mind, rememberance

quote: You are entitled to know that two entities occupy your body. One of these entities is motivated by and responds to the impulse of fear. The other is motivated by and responds to the impulse of faith. Will you be guided by faith or will you allow fear to overtake you?
author: Napoleon Hill,

quote: Beware the religion that turns you against another one. It's unlikely that it's really religion at all.
author: Joan D. Chittister,

quote: Guidance, like all God's acts of blessing under the covenant of grace, is a sovereign act. Not merely does God will to guide us in the sense of showing us his way, that we may tread it; he wills also to guide us in the more fundamental sense of ensuring that, whatever happens, whatever mistakes we may make, we shall come safely home. Slippings and strayings there will be, no doubt, but the everlasting arms are beneath us; we shall be caught, rescued, restored. This is God's promise; this is how good he is.
author: J.I. Packer,

quote: Some people say they will not believe in anything they can't see. What a catastrophe to not have any faith at all! You live only less than a half of life, if you will only believe in the things that you can see. Life is lived by those who have much faith and believe in many unseen things. If you believe in nothing that you cannot see, think about how much there is that you choose to turn your face away from! You can't see your soul and you cannot prove that it exists, therefore if you call yourself one who believes in nothing unseen, then you will forever deny your soul its existence, for the existence of the soul dwells in love, trust, anger, passion, faith, belief, strength; the soul is forever nourished by things that are unseen! And so we have too many empty bodies walking around! Bodies with souls inside that are half-dead and dying.
author: C. JoyBell C.
tags: belief, believing, faith, humanity, inspirational, inspirational-life, inspirational-quotes, soul, spirit, unseen-things

quote: There are 6 reasons that a person does anything: Love, faith, greed, boredom, fear... revenge.
author: Ally Carter,
tags: boredom, faith, fear, greed, love, revenge

quote: While you are going through your trial, you can recall your past victories and count the blessings that you do have with a sure hope of greater ones to allow if you are faithful.
author: Ezra Taft Benson

quote: Every beginner possesses a great potential to be an expert in his or her chosen field.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita,
tags: abilities, advice, beginner, beginner-s-guide, christian-life, college, courses, dont-give-up, dont-quit, education, encouragement, expert, failure, faith, great, greatness, hard-working, hope, inner-strength, interest, job, learn, learning, mentoring, never-give-up, passion, potential, school, self-confidence, self-education, self-esteem, self-love, self-study, skills, student, study, success, training, try-your-best, university, uplifting, wise-words, work, writing-advice, you-can, your-life

quote: We are not asked to SEE," said Amy. "Why need we when we KNOW?" We know--not the answer to the inevitable Why, but the incontestable fact that it is for the best. "It is an irreparable loss, but is it faith at all if it is 'hard to trust' when things are entirely bewildering?
author: Elisabeth Elliot,

quote: The question the doubter does not ask is whether faith was really useless or simply not used. What would you think of a boy who gave up learning to ride a bicycle, complaining that he hurt himself because his bicycle stopped moving so he had no choice but to fall off? If he wanted to sit comfortably while remaining stationary, he should not have chosen a bicycle but a chair. Similarly faith must be put to use, or it will become useless.
author: Os Guinness,

quote: Da used to say that lies were easy, but trust was hard. Trust is like faith: it can turn people into believers, but every time it's lost, trust becomes harder and harder to win back.
author: Victoria Schwab,
tags: distrust, doubt, faith, lying, trust, trustworthy

quote: Each day gives the opportunity for you to be treated right, to feel worthy, and to be successful. It’s a choice you have to make, a faith you have to embrace, and a standard you have to set.
author: Steve Maraboli,
tags: carpe-diem, faith, inspirational, life, motivational, success, truth

quote: When Lincoln was asked if God was on the Union’s side, Lincoln’s unvarying response was that what was really important was whether they were on God’s side.
author: Joe Wheeler,

quote: Some acts of faith, I believe, have the power to grant us something infinitely wiser than we imagine
author: Ursula Hegi,

quote: Always have faith in yourself and the universe, for one will not get you anywhere without the other. Both must be equally strong to reach your desires, for they are the wings that will lift you to your dreams.
author: Suzy Kassem,
tags: belief, bravery, courage-in-life, desires, doubt, dreams, faith, fear, fearlessness, self-doubt, strength, universe, wings, yourself

quote: Faith, Princess," the Prism Cat repeated. "It is a highly underrated weapon against the dark things in this world.
author: Terry Brooks,

quote: He has no need for faith who knows the uncreated, who has cut off rebirth, who has destroyed any opportunity for good or evil, and cast away all desire. He is indeed the ultimate man.
author: Gautama Buddha,
tags: attachment, awakening, balance, creation, desire, enlightenment, equanimity, faith, good-and-evil, know-thyself, meaning-of-life, nirvana, religion, spiritual, suffering, wisdom

quote: Fatigue can make it hard to have faith. Too much busyness can make it hard to have faith. Too much of too little solitude can impact faith. For that matter, so can a bout of hunger or overwork, anything carried to an extreme. Faith thrives on routine. Look at any monastery and you will see that. Faith keeps on keeping on.
author: Julia Cameron,

quote: There are some who are still weak in faith, who ought to be instructed, and who would gladly believe as we do. But their ignorance prevents them...we must bear patiently with these people and not use our liberty; since it brings to peril or harm to body or soul...but if we use our liberty unnecessarily, and deliberately cause offense to our neighbor, we drive away the very one who in time would come to our faith. Thus St. Paul circumcised Timothy (Acts 16:3) because simple minded Jews had taken offense; he thought: what harm can it do, since they are offended because of ignorance? But when, in Antioch, they insisted that he out and must circumcise Titus (Gal. 2:3) Paul withstood them all and to spite them refused to have Titus circumcised... He did the same when St. Peter...it happened in this way: when Peter was with the Gentiles he ate pork and sausages with them, but when the Jews came in, he abstained from this food and did not eat as he did before. Then the Gentiles who had become Christians though: Alas! we, too, must be like the Jews, eat no pork, and live according to the law of Moses. But when Paul learned that they were acting to the injury of evangelical freedom, he reproved Peter publicly and read him an apostolic lecture, saying: "If you, though a Jew, live like a Gentile, how can you compel the Gentiles to live like Jews?" (Gal. 2:14). Thus we, too, should order our lives and use our liberty at the proper time, so that Christian liberty may suffer no injury, and no offense be given to our weak brothers and sisters who are still without the knowledge of this liberty.
author: Martin Luther

quote: A disciple: I am worried about human suffering all over the world. What is the solution?Spiritual leader: The solution to our miseries lie within central atom of our being, ‘I’. Once this central atom transcends to ‘WE’, human sufferings can be resolved.
author: Santosh Kalwar,

quote: I often ask myself, 'Who would Jesus vote for?' Then I start to think that he wouldn't vote at all; however, it would not be out of apathy or disinterest, but out of perfection and light. As a miracle worker, I think he would, by the power of God's teachings, the perseverance and the truth, influence in a modern sense whoever is put into office how to best serve his fellow men. One, like his skeptics, may find that impractical. But there is a message in that no man in power can slow the momentum of the will of God, and the miracles of his teachings will be forever victorious.
author: Criss Jami,
tags: authority, christianity, faith, jesus, leadership, perfection, politics, serving, serving-others, voting

quote: People unable to bear the martyrdom [...] unintelligently jump off the path, and choose instead, conveniently enough, the world’s admiration of their proficiency. The true knight of faith is a witness, never a teacher, and in this lies the deep humanity in him which is more worth than this foolish concern for others’ weal and woe which is honoured under the name of sympathy, but which is really nothing but vanity.
author: Søren Kierkegaard,

quote:
The courage is light of one’s life,
is the beauty of today.

The hope of one’s soul,
is the promise of a tomorrow.

The times of our past,
is a wisdom for anytime.

The labour of our sacrifice and love,
is a masterpiece of our moments.

The voyage of one’s mind,
is a journey towards discovery.

The joy in one’s heart,
is a gift for everyone.

The faith of a soul,
is a key to hope and to love.

The true unconditional love of a heart
is a priceless treasure one can ever give.

For our mind, heart and soul
In any journey of rise or fall,
Let faith, hope and love breathe!
As you share it for whom your heart beats.
author: Angelica Hopes,

quote: Faith is the acknowledgment of the entire absence of all goodness in us, and the recognition of the cross as the substitute for all the want on our part. Faith saves, because it owns the complete salvation of another, and not because it contributes anything to that salvation.
author: Horatius Bonar,

quote: Maybe it's not about how long you've lived, or having the ability to hope, even when things seem hopeless. Maybe it's just about how much faith you have.
author: P.C. Cast Kristin Cast,

quote: Each moment of worry, anxiety or stress represents lack of faith in miracles, for they never cease.
author: T.F. Hodge,
tags: anxiety, belief, faith, lack-of-faith, miracles, quotes, stress, worry

quote:
The primary purpose of prayer is not to make requests. The primary purpose is to praise, to sing, to chant. Because the essence of prayer is a song, and man cannot live without a song.

Prayer may not save us. But prayer may make us worthy of being saved.
author: Abraham Joshua Heschel,

quote: Honey, nobody ever knows someone completely. You have to just enjoy what you do know and have faith in the rest.
author: Erin McCarthy,

quote: But everything I have to give, I'll give to you
author: Ray Lamontagne

quote: To fear is to have more faith in your antagonist than in Christ.
author: D.L. Moody,

quote: In God's eyes, a man who teaches one truth and nothing else is more righteous than a man who teaches a million truths and one lie.
author: Criss Jami,
tags: apologetics, certainty, faith, god, gospel, honesty, intelligence, knowledge, lies, perspective, teaching, truth, uncertainty, wisdom

quote: The only thing that guarantees an open-ended collaboration among human beings, the only thing that guarantees that this project is truly open-ended, is a willingness to have our beliefs and behaviors modified by the power of conversation.
author: Sam Harris
tags: agnosticism, atheism, belief, ethics, faith, humanism, religion, spirituality

quote: Maybe we are a little crazy. After all, we believe in things we don't see. The Scriptures say that faith is "being sure of what we hope for and certain of what we do not see" (Heb. 11:1). We believe poverty can end even though it is all around us. We believe in peace even though we hear only rumours of wars. And since we are people of expectation, we are so convinced that another world is coming that we start living as if it were already here.
author: Shane Claiborne,

quote: Spiritual pain is when you can’t stand another moment not knowing the real truth, and when you finally do know you can’t let go.
author: Shannon l. Alder
tags: adversity, crisis-of-faith, faith, love, relationship-with-god, religion, scriptures, seekers, spirtuality, testimonies, testimony, trials

quote: Orthodoxy is idolatry if it means holding the 'correct opinions about God' - 'fundamentalism' is the most extreme and salient example of such idolatry - but not if it means holding faith in the right way, that is, not holding it at all but being held by God, in love and service. Theology is idolatry if it means what we say about God instead of letting ourselves be addressed by what God has to say to us. Faith is idolatrous if it is rigidly self-certain but not if it is softened in the waters of 'doubt.
author: John D. Caputo,

quote: S'il n'existait pas Dieu il faudrait l'inventer." (If God did not exist he would have to be invented.)
author: Voltaire, Francois-Marie Arouet Voltaire, Francois-Marie Arouet

quote: You will never get everything in life but you will get enough.
author: Sanhita Baruah
tags: contentment, enough, everything, faith, feel-good, future, gift-of-life, gifts-from-heaven, happy, inspirational, life, life-is-good, love, motivational, move-on, past, present, satisfaction, smile

quote: Faith keeps our ships moving, while empathy and the memories of our experiences lead to wisdom.
author: Suzy Kassem,
tags: destiny, direction, direction-of-your-destiny, empathy, faith, faith-quotes, fate, inspirational-quotes, journey-quotes, life, life-quotes, manifest, memories, memory, motivation, purpose, purpose-quotes, suzy-kassem, truth, truth-of-life, understanding, wisdom, wise

quote: On every level of life, from housework to heights of prayer, in all judgement and effort to get things done, hurry and impatience are sure marks of the amateur.
author: Ann Voskamp,

quote: We can follow a steady upward course in a world of change without fear, welcoming opportunities
author: Henry B. Eyring

quote: Faith is simply whatever is real to us.
author: Elizabeth Kostova,

quote: Every adversity brings new experiences and new lessons.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita,
tags: adversity, challenges, christian-life, encouragement, experience, faith, fighting-spirit, hard-times, hope, inner-strength, inspirational, motivation, overcomer, positive, positive-thinking, self-help, strength, struggle, survival, surviving-hard-times

quote: God doesn't expect us to be a walking encyclopedia of biblical knowledge. He wants us to know Him, to be in a relationship with Him. This means not only hearing but allowing our understanding of God to change the way we live. Like the wise builder who laid the foundation of his house on the rock, we learn to let our knowledge of God change us.
author: Tyler Edwards,
tags: change, christianity, faith, foundation, knowledge, relationship, wise

quote: practice only envisioning yourself at the finish line and be unrelenting and fervent in racing towards that finish line. Undue preoccupation and fixation with the how's, whens, and what ifs will not only derail and further distance you from your destination, but will also feed your mind with those fatal seeds of doubt that make failure inevitable" ~ Awaken and Unleash your Victor
author: Ogor Winnie Okoye
tags: doubt, faith, positive-quotes, self-confidence, self-improvement, success

quote: Christianity, like genius, is one of the hardest concepts to forgive. We hear what we want to hear and accept what we want to accept, for the most part, simply because there is nothing more offensive than feeling like you have to re-evaluate your own train of thought and purpose in life. You have to die to an extent in your hunger for faith, for wisdom, and quite frankly, most people aren't ready to die.
author: Criss Jami,
tags: apologetics, changing, christianity, concepts, controversy, evangelism, faith, forgiveness, genius, life, misunderstood, philosophy, philosophy-of-life, religion, salvation, spirituality, theology, wisdom

quote: ~ Faith lightens the path your shadowed mind has to walk ~
author: Michelle Horst,
tags: encouraging, faith, hope, hopeful, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, inspirational-wisdom

quote: Peaceful disputes are maintained when men sincerely believe that they are morally, logically correct about the issues at hand. It is when neither side is really certain that wars are instigated.
author: Criss Jami,
tags: battles, calm, certainty, conflict, controversy, conviction, disputes, doubt, faith, fighting, insecurity, logic, morality, patience, peace, security, uncertainty, war, wisdom

quote: Do not come into agreement with fear. Activate your faith, live in victory, speak over your life and expect great things to come your way.
author: Germany Kent
tags: activate-faith, be-of-good-courage, courage, don-t-worry, doubt, enemy, enemy-quotes, faith, faith-in-god, faith-in-yourself, faith-quotes, faith-strength, fear, fear-presents-itself-bigger, fear-quotes, fearless-quotes, germany-kent, germany-kent-quote, germany-kent-quotes, getting-ahead, god, god-is-awesome, god-is-good, god-s-grace, gods-direction, gods-presence, gods-will, gods-word, great-things, hold-on, hold-onto-god, hope-guru, meant-for-you, meant-to-be, meant-to-be-quote, meant-to-be-quotes, most-high-god, motivational-speaker, my-salvation, negativity, not-fear, our-god-is-bigger, perspective, perspective-on-life, perspectives, problems, rise-up, speak-life, speak-over-your-life, stay-in-faith, the-hope-guru

quote: It was just like him, she thought; with him, a happy ending was always a foregone conclusion. But such was the power of his faith that when she was with him; she found herself believing in happy endings, too.
author: Sharon Kay Penman,

quote: To love God with all our heart, soul, and mind, and our neighbor as ourself.
author: Anonymous,

quote: Your faith was strong, but you needed proof...
author: Leonard Cohen

quote: One often has to do what they have to do in order to do what they want to do; however if you only do what you want to do then you will never do what you have to do!
author: Dr. C. Moorer,
tags: failure, faith, hope, inspirational, motivational, promise, success

quote: I couldn't care less about evidence and proof and assurances. I just want God. I want God inside me. I want God to play in my bloodstream the way sunlight amuses itself on water.
author: Elizabeth Gilbert,

quote: I see it in your eyes as I see it in hers. Remember, there is always light where there is love and if that is what is meant to happen between the two of you, then it was destined.
author: L.G. Castillo,

quote: I have often noticed that these things, which obsess me, neither bother nor impress other people even slightly. I am horribly apt to approach some innocent at a gathering, and like the ancient mariner, fix him with a wild, glitt’ring eye and say, “Do you know that in the head of the caterpillar of the ordinary goat moth there are two hundred twenty-eight separate muscles?” The poor wretch flees. I am not making chatter; I mean to change his life.
author: Annie Dillard,
tags: amen, beauty, belief, consciousness, creation, curiosity, disbelief, energy, enoughness, epiphany, exploration, exultant, faith, fate, fearless, fire, free, freedom, gaps, god, grace, growth, hallelujah, humility, illumination, intricacy, joy, joyful, joyfulness, life-force, light, living-in-the-present-moment, mindfulness, multiplicity, mystery, nature, philosopher-s-stone, philosophy, poem, poet, poetry, power, praise, prayer, prayers, praying, religion, religious-diversity, science, seeing, seeking, soul, spirit, stalking-the-gaps, the-tree-with-the-lights-in-it, tolerance, walking, watching, wonder

quote: Trustful people are the pure at heart, as they are moved by the zeal of their own trustworthiness.
author: Criss Jami,
tags: belief, childlikeness, children, confidence, cynic, deceit, discernment, faith, fear, fearful, fearless, fearlessness, happiness, heart, honesty, humility, innocence, intuition, judgment, kids, lies, love, naive, optimist, positive, positive-thinking, psychology, pure-heart, purity, reliability, selflessness, skeptic, success, suspicion, trust, trustful, trustworthiness, truth, understanding, understanding-others, vulnerability, zeal

quote: A farmer is helpless to grow grain; all he can do is provide the right conditions for the growing of grain. He cultivates the ground, he plants the seed, he waters the plants, and then the natural forces of the earth take over and up comes the grain...This is the way it is with the Spiritual Disciplines - they are a way of sowing to the Spirit... By themselves the Spiritual Disciplines can do nothing; they can only get us to the place where something can be done.
author: Richard J. Foster,

quote: It is extremely important for you to believe in yourselves not only for what you are now but for what you have the power to become. Trust in the Lord as He leads you along. He has things for you to do that you won't know about now but that will unfold later. If you stay close to Him, You will have some great adventures. You will live in a time where instead of sometimes being fulfilled, many of them will actually be fulfilled. The Lord will unfold your future bit by bit.
author: Neal A. Maxwell

quote: because it seemed too simple to accept that life was an act of faith.
author: Paulo Coelho,

quote: There is no one true church, no one chosen people.
author: Terry Tempest Williams,

quote: Remember, an easy question can have an easy answer. But a hard question must have a hard answer. And for the hardest questions of all, there may be no answer - except faith.
author: Charles Sheffield,

quote: Really, there was only one sensible thing to do. Stay the course. Pray it through, day by day, minute by minute. The Lord had an answer and it would surely come. (p. 203)
author: Janice Hanna,

quote: We need faith and the mind of the Lord Jesus to recognize something of lasting value in even our most ordinary tasks.
author: phillip yancey

quote: The lust of the flesh directs these desires [of personal union], however, to satisfaction of the body, often at the cost of a real and full communion of persons.
author: Pope John Paul II,

quote:
(about William Blake)

[Blake] said most of us mix up God and Satan. He said that what most people think is God is merely prudence, and the restrainer and inhibitor of energy, which results in fear and passivity and "imaginative death."

And what we so often call "reason" and think is so fine, is not intelligence or understanding at all, but just this: it is arguing from our *memory* and the sensations of our body and from the warnings of other people, that if we do such and such a thing we will be uncomfortable. "It won't pay." "People will think it is silly." "No one else does it." "It is immoral."

But the only way you can grow in understanding and discover whether a thing is good or bad, Blake says, is to do it. "Sooner strangle an infant in its cradle than nurse unacted desires."

For this "Reason" as Blake calls it (which is really just caution) continually nips and punctures and shrivels the imagination and the ardor and the freedom and the passionate enthusiasm welling up in us. It is Satan, Blake said. It is the only enemy of God. "For nothing is pleasing to God except the invention of beautiful and exalted things." And when a prominent citizen of his time, a logical, opining, erudite, measured, rationalistic, Know-it-all, warned people against "mere enthusiasm," Blake wrote furiously (he was a tender-hearted, violent and fierce red-haired man): "Mere enthusiasm is the All in All!
author: Brenda Ueland,

quote:
It [Communism] is not new. It is, in fact, man's second oldest faith. Its promise was whispered in the first days of the Creation under the Tree of the Knowledge of Good and Evil: "Ye shall be as gods." It is the great alternative faith of mankind. Like all great faiths, its force derives from a simple vision. Other ages have had great visions. They have always been different versions of the same vision: the vision of God and man's relationship to God. The Communist vision is the vision of Man without God.
It is the vision of man's mind displacing God as the creative intelligence of the world. It is the vision of man's liberated mind, by the sole force of its rational intelligence, redirecting man's destiny and reorganizing man's life and the world. It is the vision of man, once more the central figure of the Creation, not because God made man in his image, but because man's mind makes him the most intelligent of the animals. Copernicus and his successors displaced man as the central fact of the universe by proving that the earth was not the central star of the universe. Communism restores man to his sovereignty by the simple method of denying God.
author: Whittaker Chambers,

quote: The paradox in Christian truth is invariably due to the fact that it is the truth that exists for God. The standard of measure and the end is superhuman; and there is only one relationship possible: faith.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: Always carry champagne! In victory You deserve it & in defeat You need it!
author: Napoléon Bonaparte
tags: always, champagne, defeat, faith, life, victory

quote: It was by faith, nothing wavering, that Joseph saw God our Eternal Father and Jesus Christ, His Son.
author: Thomas S. Monson

quote: Faith in God will elevate you to next level blessings.
author: Germany Kent
tags: blessed, blessed-life, blessing-of-the-lord, blessing-quotes, blessings-in-disguise, blessings-in-your-life, blessings-quotes, faith, faith-in-god, faith-quote, faith-quotes, faith-strength, faithfulness, germany-kent, germany-kent-quote, germany-kent-quotes, god-s-plans-for-your-future, gods-grace, gods-power, gods-will, hope-guru, new-chapter, new-chapter-quotes, new-chapters, next-level, next-level-ministry, next-level-quote, next-level-quotes, next-level-thinking, power, power-of-law-of-attraction, power-of-the-subconscious-mind, powerful, powerful-forces, powerful-people, powerful-quote, powerful-women, powerful-words, religious, spiritual, spiritual-awakening, spiritual-development, spiritual-growth, spiritual-life, spiritual-quotes, spiritual-warfare, spiritual-wisdom, spirituality-quotes, the-hope-guru, truth, truth-quote, truth-quotes

quote: Each mind conceives god in its own way. There may be as many variation of the god figure as there are people in the world
author: Bangambiki Habyarimana,
tags: afterlife, agnostic, agnostic-atheism, agnostic-prayer, agnostic-quote, agnostic-quotes, agnosticism, agnostics, atheism, atheism-defined, atheism-quotes, atheist, atheist-argument, atheist-arguments, atheist-claims, atheist-club, atheist-philosophers, atheist-quotes, atheistic, atheistic-philosophy, atheistic-religion, atheists, bangambiki, belief, belief-in-god, belief-quotes, belief-system, beliefs-quotes, believer, believing, debate, despair-and-attitude, despair-hope, despair-quotes, despairing, doubt, doubters, doubtful, doubtful-thoughts, doubtfulness, doubting, doubting-mind, doubts, doubts-quotes, ethics, existence, existentialism, faith, faith-in-god, faith-in-yourself, faith-quotes, faith-reason, faith-vs-reason, faithful, faithfulness, false-god, false-gods, fear-of-god, god, goddess, gods, habyarimana-bangambiki, heaven, heaven-and-hell, heaven-on-earth, heaven-quotes, heavenly, heavenly-father, heavenly-rewards, heavens, honesty, honesty-friendship-truth, honesty-from-within, honesty-integrity, honesty-integrity-relationship, honesty-integrity-words, honesty-quotes, hope, hope-and-despair, hope-for-each-day, hope-quotes, hopeful, hopeful-and-encouraging, hopeful-quotes, hopeless, hopelessness, hopes, hoping, integrity, integrity-of-a-salesman, integrity-quotes, life, lose-hope, materialism, meaning-of-life, morality, naturalism, paradise, paradise-quotes, paradises, religion, religion-and-philoshophy, religion-spirituality, religion-vs-science, religious, religious-faith, respect, secular-ethics, self-respect, sincerity, spirituality, spirituality-quotes, spirituality-vs-religion, supernaturalism, the-great-pearl-of-wisdom, there-is-no-god, unbelief, unbelieve-quotes, unbeliever, unbelievers

quote: When we find that God's ways always coincide with our own ways, it's time to question who we're really worshipping, God or ourselves. The latter moves the nature of godliness from the King to our servant to a slave, a deduction into the realm of selfhood and then the lower, slavehood. It's a spiritual mathematics in that men who need God in his godhood are humble yet strong and spiritually ambitious while men who need a slave in their selfhood are ultimately paralyzed and will remain paralyzed.
author: Criss Jami,
tags: apologetics, faith, god, king, narcissism, self-worship, selfhood, slave, spirituality, trust, worship

quote: What is false about hope?
author: Mitch Albom,

quote: It’s so easy to lose faith and become lost in all of the politics of the world. That’s why we need the arts. To sublimate our frustration and anger into something beautiful. Freud called sublimation a virtuous defence mechanism because it is in the arts that we can find our humanity.
author: Kamand Kojouri
tags: anger, art, arts, beautiful, beauty, corporation, corrupt, corruption, create, creative, creative-arts, creativity, defence, defence-mechanism, empathy, faith, freud, freudian, frustration, give-up, hope, hopeful, hopefulness, hopeless, humanity, humanness, kamand, kamand-kojouri, kojouri, life, lose, lost, media, news, politics, psychology, sublimate, sublimation, surrender, theory, virtue, virtuous, world

quote: Never stop believing that your dreams are eternal.
author: Truth Devour,
tags: dreams, faith, hope, love, romance, sated, soul-mates, unrequited, wantin, wish

quote: I believe in free will. I think we make our own decisions and carry out or own actions. And our actions have consequences. The world is what we make it. But I think sometimes we can ask God to help us and He will.
author: Michael Grant,

quote: For years I was deathly afraid of my own weaknesses, but when I closed my eyes and let myself be vulnerable to them it allowed miracles to take place. Miracles that were only alive when I accessed my BLIND faith.
author: Bethany Brookbank,
tags: afraid, faith, growing-up, life, miracles, personal-growth, self-awareness, vulnerable, weaknesses, years

quote: I will not join the rat race because I'm not a rat. And I will not blindly follow a specific faith because I'm not a bat. The only race I'll take part in is for humans being humane. It's called the human race, and sadly it's got the least participants.
author: Suzy Kassem,
tags: bat, faith, knowledge, life, lion, philosophy, rat, rat-race, rats, relgion, religion, truth, wisdom

quote: The German philosopher Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche, who had syphilis, said that only a person of deep faith could afford the luxury of religious skepticism. Humanists, by and large educated, comfortably middle-class persons with rewarding lives like mine, find rapture enough in secular knowledge and hope. Most people can't.
author: Kurt Vonnegut,
tags: faith, hope, humanism, knowledge, nietzsche, philosophy, religion, secularism, skepticism

quote: that willing suspension of disbelief for the moment, which constitutes poetic faith
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
tags: art, faith, poetic-faith, poetry, suspension-of-disbelief, unbelievable

quote: The vermin explain their sin with sanctimonious language like, "We've prayed about it and sought counsel, and we feel it's the right thing to do." Don't let it down on them that to the Enemy what they feel is inconsequential. His moral laws don't give a rip about how any of them feel. The sludgebags have no more power to vote them in and out of existence than they have power to revoke the law of gravity.
author: Randy Alcorn,

quote: What I admire about the modern atheist is not at all his logic, but rather his gift of imagination. There will always be the cartoon versions of Christianity further perpetuated by the extremist atheists who do not possess the humility to ask real scholars and theologians its difficult questions. There is little doubt that the atheist has the bigger imagination: the first reason is due to his persistent caricatures of what constitutes a Christian; the second because of his belief that most of his questions are actually rhetorical. From this I can infer that, instead of laughing at one another (the Christian at modern atheist immaturity and the modern atheist at Christian stupidity), we would have a better chance at productivity laughing with one another as we all dumb down what we don't understand.
author: Criss Jami,

quote: A man of God would never burn or harm a temple of any kind - regardless of religion. A true man of God would see every temple or divine mansion built to glorify the Creator - as an extension of the temple closest to his home, regardless of its shape, size, or color. A man who truly recognizes and knows God can see God in all things.
author: Suzy Kassem,
tags: burn, churches, color, creator, divine-mansions, faith, god, harm, home, love, loving, man, mansion, mosques, peace, religion, religious, synagogues, temple, temples, truth

quote: I'm always talking to God about whether or not he exists - that's how I know I'm a theist.
author: Criss Jami,
tags: agnosticism, answers, apologetics, atheism, belief, belief-in-god, deism, doubt, existence, faith, faithlessness, god, pantheism, prayer, questioning, theism

quote: There is a goodness in the world that got me through, that taught me it's important to know who you are.
author: Jennifer Zeynab Joukhadar,
tags: faith, goodness, hardship, integrity, introspection, struggle

quote: There is never a moment when God is not in control. Relax! He’s got you covered.
author: Mandy Hale,
tags: faith, faith-in-god, god, peace, positive-thinking, spirituality, surrender, the-single-woman, trust

quote: The presence of a noble nature, generous in its wishes, ardent in its charity, changes the lights for us: we begin to see things again in their larger, quieter masses, and to believe that we too can be seen and judged in the wholeness of our character.
author: George Eliot,

quote: We were as Hansel and Gretel and we ventured out into the black forest of the world.
author: Patti Smith,

quote:
This world’s anguish is no different
from the love we insist on holding back.
author: Aberjhani,
tags: afghanistan-war, agape-love, anguish, casualties-of-war, child-victims-of-war, children-killed-in-war, conflict-resolution, faith, fear, grief, gun-laws, gun-violence, hope, love, nonviolent-conflict-resolution, pain, peace, peace-movement, peacemaking, police-reform, police-shootings, russia-and-ukraine-conflict, spiritual-love, syrian-civil-war, tragedy, unconditional-love, violence, war, world-suicide-prevention-day

quote:
What was the opposite of linkage blindness? What described being certain of something without any kind of evidence?

...The term was faith.
author: Barry Lyga,

quote: Faith requires following the power of a whisper.
author: Shannon L. Alder
tags: beliefs, commonsense, faith, follow-the-spirit, gut-feelings, holy-ghost, intuition, miracles, promptings, religion, visions, whispers

quote:
Just above our terror, the stars painted this story
in perfect silver calligraphy. And our souls, too often
abused by ignorance, covered our eyes with mercy.
author: Aberjhani,
tags: calligraphy, classic-quotes, faith, grace, hope, ignorance, inspiration, marvelousmonday-quotes, mercy, nanowrimo, national-novel-writing-month, peace, peacism, quotes-by-famous-authors, quotes-by-famous-poets, silver, souls, spirituality, stars, survival, terrorism, the-soul, war, world-suicide-prevention-day

quote: You asked the Holy Spirit for a miracle, and now that you’ve got one you’re trying to argue it away. People who don’t believe in miracles shouldn’t pray for them.
author: David Wilkerson,

quote: Men and women are needed whose prayers will give to the world the utmost power of God; who will make His promises to blossom with rich and full results. God is waiting to hear us and challenges us to bring Him to do this thing by our praying. He is asking us, to-day, as He did His ancient Israel, to prove Him now herewith." Behind God's Word is God Himself, and we read: "Thus saith the Lord, the Holy One of Israel, his Maker: Ask of me of things to come and concerning my sons, and concerning the work of my hands, command ye me." As though God places Himself in the hands and at the disposal of His people who pray - as indeed He does. The dominant element of all praying is faith, that is conspicuous, cardinal and emphatic. Without such faith it is impossible to please God, and equally impossible to pray.
author: E.M. Bounds,

quote: It is certain that an atom of goodness on the path of faith is never lost.
author: Rumi

quote: Self abandoned, relaxed and effortless, I seemed to have laid me down in the dried-up bed of a great river; I heard a flood loosened in remote mountains, I felt the torrent come; to rise I had no will, to flee I had no strength.
author: Charlotte Brontë,

quote: Trusting God's grace means trusting God's love for us rather than our love for God. […] Therefore our prayers should consist mainly of rousing our awareness of God's love for us rather than trying to rouse God's awareness of our love for him, like the priests of Baal on Mount Carmel (1 Kings 18:26-29).
author: Peter Kreeft,

quote: Every tomorrow has two handles. We can take hold of it with the handle of anxiety or the handle of faith.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Although the far territory of the extreme can exert an intoxicating pull on susceptible individuals of all bents, extremism seems to be especially prevalent among those inclined by temperament or upbringing toward religious pursuits. Faith is the very antithesis of reason, injudiciousness a crucial component of spiritual devotion. And when religious fanaticism supplants ratiocination, all bets are suddenly off.
author: Jon Krakauer,

quote: There are certain mortal moments and minutes that matter. Certain hingepoints in the history of each human. Some seconds are so decisive they shrink the soul, while others are spent, so as to stretch the soul.
author: Neal A. Maxwell
tags: accountiblity, choices, courage, destiny, faith, god, heavenly-father, history, hope, human, humanity

quote: This day is not a sieve, losing time. With each passing minute, each passing year, there's this deepening awareness that I am filling, gaining time. We stand on the brink of eternity.
author: Ann Voskamp,

quote: While fear depletes power, faith gives wings for the soul’s elevation.
author: T.F. Hodge,
tags: anxiety, believe, elevation, faith, fear, power, quotes, soul, spirituality, wings

quote: When you SEE into the invisible, you will DARE to do the impossible!
author: John Paul Warren
tags: belief, courage, faith, john-paul, john-paul-warren, motivation

quote: Deep down under where his heart resided, strangled up in thorny vines of guilt, anger, fear and longing, there lay something deeper in him, something that he couldn’t see but she could.
author: Carol Oates,

quote: I guarantee you that after you die you will not say 'I spent too much time praying; I wish I had watched more TV instead.
author: Peter Kreeft,

quote: Leaving your religion and having to invent your own system of values is a big deal, after all.
author: Therese Doucet

quote: The single most important piece of advice about prayer is one word: Begin!
author: Peter Kreeft,

quote: I've been a Christian since I was a little girl. But my Christianity is a muddy mess of thoughts and opinions and making God into what works for me-like going shopping at the mall and picking out whatever I want, putting together faith like I would an outfit. Somehow I don't think the Creator, the I AM, the savior of the world is something we can mix and match to out liking.
author: Cindy Martinusen-Coloma,

quote: Forgiveness without understanding is like faith without proof.
author: Jessica Francis Kane,

quote:
So as I shivered, naked and damp, in front of the bathroom mirror, I raised my eyes skyward. "I hope we're still okay."

I got no answer, but then, I didn't really expect one. Answer or not, it didn't matter. That's the thing about faith, I guess.
author: Chloe Neill

quote: God's plan for your life is happening right now. It doesn't begin when you get married or when you get your dream job or when everything feels perfect. You are IN the plan. - TLC's friend Kris (p.159)
author: Tara Leigh Cobble,

quote: If you stumble at mere believability, what are you living for? Isn't love hard to believe? Don't you bully me with your politeness! Love is hard to believe, ask any lover. Life is hard to believe, ask any scientist. God is hard to believe, ask any believer. What is your problem with hard to believe?
author: Yann Martel,

quote: Doa yang tulus dan dengan cinta, adalah kekuatan besar yang bisa menyelamatkan siapa pun, termasuk orang yang mendoakannya.
author: Amanda Inez,

quote:
Hope and faith underlie a promise,
and love energizes men to realize it.
author: Toba Beta,
tags: faith, hope, love, promise, realize, strength

quote: I guess that's where faith comes in, the faith of a child to believe in Santa, the faith of an adult to believe in God, maybe faith is what makes something real? Maybe Rose had believed enough to create her own afterlife, maybe that's the reward of faith...
author: Gillibran Brown,

quote: Without struggle, success has no value.
author: Aaron Lauritsen,
tags: 100-days-drive, 100daysdrive, acceptance, accomplish, ambition, author, awakening, be-happy, be-proud, believe, bestseller, break-barriers, carmaker, chances, change, chase-dreams, cherish, compassion, competition, confidence, conquer, conquer-fear, content, control-you-life, courage, crossroads, destiny, determination, dig-deep, don-t-give-up, don-t-worry-be-happy, dream-big, dreamer, empower, energy, explore, faith, fearless, find-yourself, follow-your-dreams, follow-your-heart, follow-your-own-path, forgive, freedom, fresh-start, goal-setting, goals, goals-in-life, good-soul, happiness, hope, humanity, humility, inner-beauty, inner-strength, inspiration, journey, joy, judgement, liberate, liberating, life, life-lessons, light, live-life-quotes, love-thy-neighbor, love-thyself, love-yourself, luck, never-quit, no-regrets, nomad, one-life, opportunity, parenthood, perspective, positive-thinking, power, pride, push-limits, reflections, resiliency, respect, risk-taking, road-trip, satisfaction, service-to-others, soar, soul-food, spirituality, start-all-over, strength, struggle, success, thick-skin, think-outside-the-box, values, wander, wanderlust, writer

quote: Mist to mist, drops to drops. For water thou art, and unto water shalt thou return.
author: Kamand Kojouri
tags: all-is-water, aqua, art, burial, bury, clean, cleanse, creek, dead, death, drop, droplet, energy, essence, faith, funeral, island, kamand, kamand-kojouri, kojouri, lake, life, live, living, mist, mortality, ocean, philosophy, pool, purify, quote, rain, rainwater, religion, renew, resurrect, resurrection, return, river, sea, seas, shalt, soul, spirit, stream, thou, vapour, water, water-is-life, waterway

quote:
The mystic chords of memory, stretching from every battle-field, and patriot grave, to every living heart and hearth-stone, all over this broad land, will yet swell the chorus of the Union, when again touched, as surely they will be, by the better angels of our nature.
--as quoted in THE RIVER OF WINGED DREAMS
author: Abraham Lincoln
tags: aberjhani, angels, civil-war, democracy, destiny, determination, faith, hope, patriotism, u-s-presidents, unity

quote: The language of light can only be decoded by the heart.
author: Suzy Kassem,
tags: ancient, awareness, beauty, beliefs, compassionate, conscience, conscious, consciousness, cosmic-heart, divine-heart, empathetic, faith, feelings, good-heart, good-person, heart, heart-driven, heart-languages, heartful, holy-books, language, languages, light, love, meaning, pure, pure-heart, religion, religious, right-mind, suzy-kassem, transcripts, truth, words

quote: You can’t give somebody faith. They either got it or they don’t.
author: Karen Marie Moning,

quote: Awakening to faith is not a one-time event, but a continuously unfolding reality. The journey of faith is not a race, but a marathon of love that each person walks at a different pace.
author: A. Helwa,
tags: awakening-in-love, faith, inspirational, inspirational-quotes, interfaith, islam, islamic-quotes, muslim-quotes, muslim-women, quran

quote: If the Creator stood before a million men with the light of a million lamps, only a few would truly see him because truth is already alive in their hearts. Truth can only be seen by those with truth in them. He who does not have Truth in his heart, will always be blind to it.
author: Suzy Kassem,
tags: alive, attitude, blind, blinded, blindness, conscience, creator, ego, faith, falsehood, finding-truth, god, heart, humanity, ignorant, illumination, lamps, lies, life, light, man, mankind, media, men, million, people, reason, recognize, religion, rumors, see, seeiking-truth, seeking-god, society, truth, truthful, vision

quote: Reading a book about something can be an obstacle to doing it because it gives you the impression that you are doing what you are only thinking about doing. It is tempting to remain in the comfortable theater of our imagination instead of the real world, to fall in love with the idea of becoming a saint and loving God and neighbor instead of doing the actual work, because the idea makes no demands on you. It is like a book on a shelf. But, as Dostoyevsky says, 'love in action is a harsh and dreadful thing compared to love in dreams' (The Brothers Karamazov).
author: Peter Kreeft,

quote: The Latin words humus, soil/earth, and homo, human being, have a common derivation, from which we also get our word 'humble.' This is the Genesis origin of who we are: dust - dust that the Lord God used to make us a human being. If we cultivate a lively sense of our origin and nurture a sense of continuity with it, who knows, we may also acquire humility.
author: Eugene Peterson,

quote: What has happened to create this doubt is that a problem (such as a deep conflict or a bad experience) has been allowed to usurp God's place and become the controlling principle of life. Instead of viewing the problem from the vantage point of faith, the doubter views faith from the vantage point of the problem. Instead of faith sizing up the problem, the situation ends with the problem scaling down faith. The world of faith is upside down, and in the topsy-turvy reality of doubt, a problem has become god and God has become a problem.
author: OS Guiness

quote:
He that hath the steerage of my course,
Direct my sail.
author: William Shakespeare,

quote: But I don't know how to fight. All I know how to do is stay alive.
author: Alice Walker The Color Purple

quote: Faith to me is trusting in every evidence that something is
author: Richelle E. Goodrich,
tags: assurance, belief, believing, confidence, conviction, faith, hope, richelle, richelle-goodrich, trust

quote: The Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, said, When Allah loves a people, He tries them.
author: Leila Aboulela ,

quote: Realizing the seriously ruthless, venomous habits and agendas of evil always instills a more fierce passion and longing for a closer God. Men, out of pride, may claim their own authorities over what constitutes good and evil; they may self-proclaim a keen knowledge of subjective morality through religion or science. But that is only if they are acknowledging the work of evil as a cartoon-like, petty little rain cloud in the sky that merely wants to dampen one's spirits. On the contrary, a man could be without a doubt lit with the strength, the peace, and the knowledge of the gods, his gods, but when or if the devils grow weary in unsuccessful attempts to torment him, they begin tormenting his loved ones, or, if not his loved ones, anyone who may attempt to grasp his philosophies. No matter how godly he may become, God is, in the end, his only hope and his only grace for the pressures built around him - it is left up to a higher authority and a more solid peace and a wider love to eclipse not just one's own evils but all evils for goodness to ultimately matter. If all men were gods, each being would dwell in a separate prison cell, hopeless, before finally imploding into nothingness.
author: Criss Jami,
tags: angels, apologetics, bad, badness, demons, devil, ego, evil, faith, god, good, goodness, grace, hope, hopelessness, humility, love, mercy, morality, peace, philosophy, possession, pride, prison, religion, satan, science, security, sin, spirit-realm, spirits, spiritual, spirituality

quote: There is nothing anti-intellectual in the leap of faith, for faith is not believing without proof but trusting without reservation.
author: William Sloane Coffin,

quote: Perhaps true faith is a form of insanity.
author: Kristine Kathryn Rusch,

quote: I believed in immaculate conception and spontaneous combustion. I believed in aliens from outer space and vampires, prophecy, and the resurrection of the dead. I had deja vu many times each day. I was thirteen.
author: Kate Braverman,
tags: belief, deja-vu, faith, prophecy, teen, thirteen

quote: Спомням си как през летните следобеди, които прекарвах там, баба ми, привършила домашната работа, сядаше до прозореца на светло и вадеше от своя скришен сандък една огромна Библия с твърди корици, обвита с тогавашния официозен вестник "Работническо дело" по конспиративни причини. Вече знаех, че комунизмът и Библията никак не се обичаха.
author: Георги Господинов,

quote: We try too much and trust too little. Count the times God's Book tells us to "try." Now count the times it tells us to "trust.
author: Peter Kreeft,

quote: Your mind can go ahead and imagine what it wants to imagine, but a true friend will always remain true, in spite of the false messages running through your mind.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: confidence, confiding-in-someone, faith, false-thinking, false-thoughts, go-ahead, imagination, imagine, insinuation, message, messages, mind, misunderstanding, thinking, true-friends, true-love, trust, understanding, your-mind

quote:
And then all that has divided us will merge
And then compassion will be wedded to power
And then softness will come to a world that is harsh and unkind
And then both men and women will be gentle
And then both women and men will be strong
And then no person will be subject to another's will
And then all will be rich and free and varied
And then the greed of some will give way to the needs of many
And then all will share equally in the Earth's abundance
And then all will care for the sick and the weak and the old
And then all will nourish the young
And then all will cherish life's creatures
And then all will live in harmony with each other and the Earth
And then everywhere will be called Eden once again.
author: Judy Chicago
tags: compassion, equality, faith, freedom, ideal, longing, poetry, unity, utopia, world-to-come

quote: I have been a skeptic all my life, and it took me a long time to affirm the Seed of Christ through actual experience. Like scientists, I ultimately trust experience….
author: Amos Smith,
tags: believe, change, courage, dig-deep, don-t-judge, explore, faith, find-yourself, goal-setting, laugh

quote: As the essence of courage is to stake one's life on a possibility, so the essence of faith is to believe the possibility exists.
author: William Salter

quote: When we look for success, it should be for the sole purpose of boasting sincerely in Christ. There's no other reason for it. Success is only worth it when the more intense it gets for you, the more you find yourself bragging for his glory rather than your own.
author: Criss Jami,
tags: apologetics, arrogance, boast, brag, christ, faith, gloat, glorification, glorification-of-god, glorifying-god, glory, god, humility, praise, success, worship

quote: You can get lost on your way home. You can get lost looking for love. You can get lost between jobs. You can get lost looking for God. However it happens, take heart. Others before you have found a way in the wilderness, where there are as many angels as there are wild beasts, and plenty of other lost people too. All it takes is one of them to find you. All it takes is you to find one of them. However it happens, you could do worse than to kneel down and ask a blessing, remembering how many knees have kissed this altar before you.
author: Barbara Brown Taylor

quote: Most reject the more repugnant or indefensible dogmas while still holding onto some core belief. Many believers will proudly describe themselves as "reasonable" or "rational" based on how little of their religion they still embrace versus how much they now reject. I think it's funny when people realize that the less you believe the more reasonable you are, but they stop before they reach the logical conclusion.
author: Aron Ra
tags: atheism, atheists, belief, dogma, faith, god, logic, rationality, reason, religion, skepticism, skepticism-and-religion, skepticism-of-religion

quote: Today is the day you have to start believing in yourself. No one can do it for you anymore.
author: Lauren Graham "Someday Someday Maybe"

quote: It was my first clue that atheists are my brothers and sisters of another faith, and every word they speak speaks of faith. Like me, they go as far as the legs of reason will carry them—and then they leap.
author: Yann Martel,

quote: The prison inspector and the warders, though they had never understood or gone into the meaning of these dogmas and of all that went on in church, believed that they must believe, because the higher authorities and the Tsar himself believed in it. Besides, though faintly (and themselves unable to explain why), they felt that this faith defended their cruel occupations. If this faith did not exist it would have been more difficult, perhaps impossible, for them to use all their powers to torment people, as they were now doing, with a quiet conscience. The inspector was such a kind-hearted man that he could not have lived as he was now living unsupported by his faith.
author: Leo Tolstoy,

quote: But all the while, there was one thing we most needed even from the start, and certainly will need from here on out into the New Jerusalem: the ability to take our freedom seriously and act on it, to live not in fear of mistakes but in the knowledge that no mistake can hold a candle to the love that draws us home. My repentance, accordingly, is not so much for my failings but for the two-bit attitude toward them by which I made them more sovereign than grace. Grace - the imperative to hear the music, not just listen for errors - makes all infirmities occasions of glory.
author: Robert Farrar Capon,
tags: faith, freedom, grace, jesus, law, love

quote: A conscious human is driven by their conscience, not popular opinion.
author: Suzy Kassem,
tags: be-different, brainwashing, conscience, conscious, consciousness, culture, different, ego, faith, followers, free-mind, god, heart, human, humanity, individual, leader, leadership, mankind, masses, mental-slavery, mind, politics, pop-culture, popular-culture, popular-opinion, programming, purity, sheep, the-masses, think, think-for-yourself, thinking, truth, unique, uniqueness

quote: Faith is a luxury for those who are able to ignore what the rest of us must see every day. Pessimism, distrust, and irony are the holy trinity of my religion, irony in particular.
author: Brando Skyhorse,
tags: distrust, faith, irony, pessimism, religion, trinity

quote: He does not regard the quantity of faith, but the quality. He does not measure its degree, but its truth. He will not break any bruised reed, nor quench any smoking flax. He will never let it be said that any perished at the foot of the cross.
author: J.C. Ryle

quote: Hope and faith goes hand-in-hand, because without hope there is no faith. The same goes with want and needs, without any wants, there no need to have a need
author: Temitope Owosela
tags: believe-in-yourself, faith, hope, needs, success, wants

quote: those who have loved are those that have found God
author: Guru Nanak

quote: Then I knew that the sign I had asked for was not a little thing, not a passing nod of recognition, and a phrase came back to me from my childhood of the veil of the temple being rent from top to bottom.
author: Evelyn Waugh,

quote: That the stars guide us, but do not compel us. It is our free will that determines the outcome of all things. God does impose his will on us, rather he makes it known and allows us to choose if we will follow it.
author: Kathleen McGowan,

quote: Your body - every body is a marvel. A wonder of creation. [...] The day your first opened your eyes, Anna, God asked just one thing: that you live.
author: Emma Donoghue,

quote:
Stone, steel, dominions pass,
Faith too, no wonder;
So leave alone the grass
That I am under.
author: A.E. Housman,

quote:
Christian hands never clasp
and He doesn't give gifts for gain
because a gift can never stop being a gift -
it is always meant to be given.
author: Ann Voskamp,

quote: I can't make those two realities -- what I've lost and what I've found -- fit together in some tidy pattern of divine causality. I just have to hold them on the one hand and on the other, just like that.
author: Kate Braestrup,

quote: How do we remain faithful to our own spiritual imagination and not betray what we know in our own bodies? The world is holy. We are holy. All life is holy.
author: Terry Tempest Williams,

quote: Shoulders are from God, and burdens too.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer,

quote: Come Judgment Day, we may find that Mumbo Jumbo the God of the Congo was the Big Boss all along.
author: Robert A. Heinlein,

quote:
Is it folly to believe in something that is intangible? After all, some of the greatest intangibles are Love, Hope, and Wonder.

Another is Deity.

The choice to be a fool is yours.
author: Vera Nazarian,
tags: belief, deity, faith, folly, god, hope, intangible, love, wonder

quote: Men cannot expect to do ill and fare well, but to find that done to them which they did to others.
author: Matthew Henry,

quote: It may be a procession of faithful failures that enriches the soil of godly success. Faithful actions are not religious acts. They are not even necessary actions undertaken by people of faith. Faithful actions, whether they are marked by success or they end in failure, are actions that are compelled by goodness.
author: Archbishop Desmond Tutu

quote: I believe we are more ready to embrace our lives in the here and now when we are able to recognize the continuity between the immanence of God in our world and eternity. Rather than simply waiting to be liberated to another time or place, we are being invited to collaborate in the healing and redemption of our world.
author: Mark Scandrette,

quote: Dusty, dark, cold, and hard, coal has no beauty of its own, but when it is consummated by fire it is beautiful and becomes what it was designed to be.
author: Frederica Mathewes-Green,

quote: The sun is still there... even if clouds drift over it. Once you have experienced the reality of sunshine you may weep, but you will never feel ice about your heart again.
author: Elizabeth Goudge,

quote: Ultimately we have nothing to fear. Jesus loves us, and he invites us to be confident in that love. As we seek to obey Him, we are not called to assess the risk involved and determine whether or not obedience will be beneficial or safe for us. We are simply called to trust and obey.
author: Dan Baumann,

quote: As goes the family, so goes the faith; as goes the faith, so goes the culture.
author: Kenneth L. Gentry Jr.,

quote: If we could summarize all, or almost all, of the New Testament letters, we would not be too far off the mark to say the theme is: “Grow up!” Just grow up.
author: David A. Fiensy,
tags: christian, christianity, church, faith, god, hope, love, spiritual, spiritualism, understanding

quote: I guess this thing we call faith is a climb. I always wanted to think of it as a big slide straight into the arms of God who waits at the bottom to catch us. But instead, He's a God who's on top of things - & like any mountain you climb, the closer we get to Him, the steeper the terrain.
author: Lisa Samson

quote: So much had been surrendered! And to such little purpose! There had been mad wilful rejections, monstrous forms of self-torture and self-denial, whose origin was fear and whose result was a degradation infinitely more terrible than that fancied degradation from which, in their ignorance, they had sought to escape (...)
author: Oscar Wilde,

quote: The conflicting missions of the two armies seemed to have no fog, no gray, only black-and-white clarity. I had lived my life in terms of compromise, rule-bending, trade-offs, concessions, bargaining, striking deals, finding middle ground. In these two great armies, there was no such thing. Good was good, and evil was evil, and they shared no common ground.
author: Randy Alcorn,

quote:
sometime life is full of joy,and sometime life is full of pain and tears
but we have to defeat it
author: Meena Khan

quote:
The Power that knows the way will take care of you. The One who makes the sun shine, the grass grow, the apples grow perfectly on apple trees. The food that sustains us, nourishes us, everything has been lovingly provided for us. Have faith. Trust the Power that knows the way. This is a first step. To have total faith and total trust in the Infinite, the One. You
may call this God if you want to. Makes no difference what you call it. It is within you. It is without you. It is everywhere. (p. 195)
author: Robert Adams,
tags: faith, godrealization, nonduality, oneness, robert-adams, selfrealization, surrender, trust-in-god

quote: The power of one is above all things the power to believe in yourself, often well beyond any latent ability you may have previously demonstrated. The mind is the athlete; the body is simply the means it uses to run faster or longer, jump higher, shoot straighter, kick better, swim harder, hit further, or box better. Hoppie's dictum to me, "First with the head and then with the heart," was more than simply mixing brains with guts. It meant thinking well beyond the powers of normal concentration and then daring your courage to follow your thoughts.
author: Bryce Courtenay,

quote: It is the test of a good religion whether you can joke about it.
author: G.K. Chesterton

quote: Do you know, the only people I can have a conversation with are the Jews? At least when they quote scripture at you they are not merely repeating something some priest has babbled in their ear. They have the great merit of disagreeing with nearly everything I say. In fact, they disagree with almost everything they say themselves. And most importantly, they don't think that shouting strengthens their argument.
author: Iain Pears,
tags: argument, blind-faith, disagreement, discussion, doctrine, faith, freedom-of-thought, independent-thought, jews, judaism, religion, shouting

quote:
Some communities don't permit open, honest inquiry about the things that matter most. Lots of people have voiced a concern, expressed a doubt, or raised a question, only to be told by their family, church, friends, or tribe: "We don't discuss those things here."

I believe the discussion itself is divine. Abraham does his best to bargain with God, most of the book of Job consists of arguments by Job and his friends about the deepest questions of human suffering, God is practically on trial in the book of Lamentations, and Jesus responds to almost every question he's asked with...a question.
author: Rob Bell,
